title: Capturing Industrial Information Models with Ontologies and Constraints

author: Evgeny Kharlamov, Department of Computer Science, University of Oxford

segmentation: Thank you so the first talk is about capturing industrial information models with ontologies and constraints.
Hooking back to the keynote of today, this is more about semantic that about the web and what we're interested in is to facilitate smart factories.

For us, a more relevant perspective on smart factories is from the software side.
From this point, from the software point of view, is most smart factory is a fully computerized software system that has a stack of stack of several layers of software.
Let's go through these layers and see what they are.
At the bottom layer there is software controlling individual devices, like for example this conveyor belt.
It has software embedded in it and this software look after positioning of things about the speed A takes care of stopping machine when something goes wrong.
If you move to the next layer, controlling clear, then there is a software that takes care of several machines at the same time, like on this picture, there is a conveyor belt.
There is a routing system.
Then there is a storage system and there is a bunch of black boxes above that that have software, and this software is taking care of orchestration of this of these devices.
At the higher level of the supervisory level, there is factory wide integration happening.
There is software that controls the whole plant basically.
It looks like that so you can see the whole plant and with the help of this software you can do what these folks are usually doing, so monitoring diagnostics and stuff like that.
